notes: Das Verb 'съм' entspricht dem deutschen 'sein' und ist unregelmäßig.
etymology: Bulgarian verb derived from Slavic root. Infinitive form ends in -м (first person singular present)
cultural_note: Essential action word. Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person and number
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Съм' ≈ 'sein'. Bulgarisches Verb. Sehr häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: Глаголът 'sein' е неправилен и служи за описания и времена. Основните форми са 'ich bin', 'du bist', 'er/sie ist', 'wir sind', 'ihr seid', 'sie sind'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person, number, and tense. Perfective/imperfective aspect distinction important

etymology: Bulgarian verb derived from Slavic root. Infinitive form ends in -м (first person singular present)
cultural_note: Essential action word. Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person and number
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Правя' ≈ 'machen'. Bulgarisches Verb. Sehr häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Machen' е правилен глагол за 'правя' и често се комбинира със съществителни: 'Hausaufgaben machen' (правя домашни), 'Fotos machen' (правя снимки).
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person, number, and tense. Perfective/imperfective aspect distinction important

etymology: Bulgarian verb derived from Slavic root. Infinitive form ends in -м (first person singular present)
cultural_note: Essential action word. Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person and number
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Говоря' ≈ 'sprechen'. Bulgarisches Verb. Sehr häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Sprechen' е неправилен: 'ich spreche', 'du sprichst', 'er spricht'; минало: 'sprach', Partizip II 'gesprochen'. Често се комбинира с езиков обект: 'Deutsch sprechen'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person, number, and tense. Perfective/imperfective aspect distinction important

etymology: Bulgarian verb derived from Slavic root. Infinitive form ends in -м (first person singular present)
cultural_note: Essential action word. Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person and number
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Чувам' ≈ 'hören'. Bulgarisches Verb. Sehr häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Hören' е правилен: 'ich höre', 'du hörst'. Комбинация 'von etwas hören' означава 'чувам за нещо'. В израза 'anhören' става отделяем глагол.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person, number, and tense. Perfective/imperfective aspect distinction important

etymology: Bulgarian verb derived from Slavic root. Infinitive form ends in -м (first person singular present)
cultural_note: Essential action word. Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person and number
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Карам' ≈ 'fahren'. Bulgarisches Verb. Häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Fahren' описва движение с превозно средство. Формите: 'ich fahre', 'du fährst', 'er fährt'; минало 'fuhr', Partizip 'gefahren'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person, number, and tense. Perfective/imperfective aspect distinction important

etymology: Bulgarian verb derived from Slavic root. Infinitive form ends in -м (first person singular present)
cultural_note: Essential action word. Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person and number
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Живея' ≈ 'leben'. Bulgarisches Verb. Häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Leben' означава 'живея/съществувам'. Израз: 'in Deutschland leben'. За 'живея в жилище' употребете 'wohnen'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person, number, and tense. Perfective/imperfective aspect distinction important

etymology: Bulgarian verb derived from Slavic root. Infinitive form ends in -м (first person singular present)
cultural_note: Essential action word. Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person and number
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Уча' ≈ 'lernen'. Bulgarisches Verb. Häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Lernen' покрива учене/подготовка: 'Deutsch lernen'. Не бъркайте с 'studieren', което означава следвам в университет.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person, number, and tense. Perfective/imperfective aspect distinction important

etymology: Bulgarian verb derived from Slavic root. Infinitive form ends in -м (first person singular present)
cultural_note: Essential action word. Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person and number
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Пазарувам' ≈ 'einkaufen'. Bulgarisches Verb. Häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Einkaufen' е отделяем глагол: 'ich kaufe ein'. Използва се за ежедневни покупки.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian verbs conjugate for person, number, and tense. Perfective/imperfective aspect distinction important
